    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addColor(String colorName, int c)
      This will manually add a color to the colors hashmap
      void drawColors(float x, float y, int txtColor)
      This will draw the colors in the colors HashMap and also show their names
      int getColor(String colorName)
      This will return the color, as an int, by name
      static String getColorHex(int c)
      Get the input color as hex code
      static String getColorHSB(int c)
      Get the input color as HSB 360
      static String getColorRGB(int c)
      Get the input color as RGB
      static String[] getColorValue(int c)
      This will simply return Strings for the input color as RGB, HSB, and hex
      static int getComplimentary(int c)
      This will return the color directly across from the input color see http://edtech2.boisestate.edu/eckela/images/Color-Schemes1.gif for color stuff
      static int[] getEvenDivisions(int c, int divisionCount)
      This will simply split the color wheel into even increments starting with the input color
      static int[] getEvenDivisions(int c, int divisionCount, float angle)
      This will split up a portion of the color wheel into the specified number of colors
      static int[] getSplitComplementary(int c, float splitAngle)
      This is like the compliment, but will split it into two colors spaced by the splitAngle
      static int[] getSquare(int c)
      This will find the four colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
      static int[] getTetradic(int c, float angle)
      This will essentially find two complimentary pairs spaced by the input angle
      static int[] getTriadic(int c)
      This will find three colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
      void readColors(String file)
      This will read in a json file and try to create a new Colors object with these colors
      static void writeColorTemplate()
      This simple function will write out a template that can be manually edited Note that each json file needs to include its own name field

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public int getColor(String colorName)
        This will return the color, as an int, by name
        Parameters:
        colorName - String of the name of the color.. assuming it has been loaded via readColors
        Returns:
        the target color

      • addColor

        public void addColor(String colorName,
                     int c)
        This will manually add a color to the colors hashmap
        Parameters:
        colorName - String of the name of the color to add
        c - int of the actual color to match the name

      • readColors

        public void readColors(String file)
        This will read in a json file and try to create a new Colors object with these colors
        Parameters:
        file - String of the location of the color json file

      • writeColorTemplate

        public static void writeColorTemplate()
        This simple function will write out a template that can be manually edited Note that each json file needs to include its own name field

      • getComplimentary

        public static int getComplimentary(int c)
        This will return the color directly across from the input color see http://edtech2.boisestate.edu/eckela/images/Color-Schemes1.gif for color stuff
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:

      • getSquare

        public static int[] getSquare(int c)
        This will find the four colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        Returns:
        a color array with the input color as the first element

      • getTetradic

        public static int[] getTetradic(int c,
                                float angle)
        This will essentially find two complimentary pairs spaced by the input angle
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        angle - The angle [out of 360] from the input color
        Returns:
        An array of four colors, the first being the input color

      • getTriadic

        public static int[] getTriadic(int c)
        This will find three colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        Returns:
        An array of three colors, the first being the input color

      • getSplitComplementary

        public static int[] getSplitComplementary(int c,
                                          float splitAngle)
        This is like the compliment, but will split it into two colors spaced by the splitAngle
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        splitAngle - The angle between the two far end colors
        Returns:
        An array of three colors, the first being the input color

      • getEvenDivisions

        public static int[] getEvenDivisions(int c,
                                     int divisionCount)
        This will simply split the color wheel into even increments starting with the input color
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        divisionCount - The number of colors to divide the color wheel into
        Returns:
        An array of specified size of colors

      • getEvenDivisions

        public static int[] getEvenDivisions(int c,
                                     int divisionCount,
                                     float angle)
        This will split up a portion of the color wheel into the specified number of colors
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        divisionCount - The number of colors to divide the color wheel into
        angle - The amount of degrees that this division should take up
        Returns:
        An array of specified size of colors

      • getColorValue

        public static String[] getColorValue(int c)
        This will simply return Strings for the input color as RGB, HSB, and hex
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        Returns:
        A String[] with the values of the input color. RGB, HSB, and hex

      • getColorRGB

        public static String getColorRGB(int c)
        Get the input color as RGB
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        Returns:
        String in RGB

        public static String getColorHSB(int c)
        Get the input color as HSB 360
        Parameters:
        c - The input color
        Returns:
        String in HSB 360

      • getColorHex

        public static String getColorHex(int c)
        Get the input color as hex code
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • drawColors

        public void drawColors(float x,
                       float y,
                       int txtColor)
        This will draw the colors in the colors HashMap and also show their names
        Parameters:
        x - float x coord of where to draw it
        y - float y coord of where to draw it
        txtColor - the color of the text
